websiteBuilder.description: A quick, practical walkthrough to customize your site - content, images, styles, and publishing.

pickPage.title: 1) Pick a page (or template)
bullets: Open the Website Builder and select the page you want to edit (Home, Services, etc.).
Each page is made of 'sections' (Hero, Gallery, Service Grid, Rich Text, FAQ, etc.).
Click a section card to select it; the editor shows its fields on the right.

editText.title: 2) Edit text & layout
bullets: Headings & body: click the field and type. Rich text fields support basic formatting.
Per-section controls include alignment, max width, padding, and optional 'bleed' (edge-to-edge).
Advanced users: each section has an 'Advanced: raw JSON props' area for exact control.

images.title: 3) Add or replace images (everywhere)
bullets: Any image field supports upload from your device (Upload or drag & drop).
Galleries & carousels: add multiple items with 'Add image', each slot has its own uploader.
Service cards and logo clouds also include uploadable image fields.
Uploaded files go to Assets and can be reused across pages.
images.footnote: Tip: Prefer JPG/WEBP. Hero ~1600-2400px wide; gallery ~1200px. Large files are auto-sized; variants are created for faster pages.

pageStyle.title: 4) Global 'Page Style' controls
bullets: Background: set a solid color or upload a full-page background image (covers the whole page).
Text colors: choose Heading, Body, and Link colors for the entire page.
Typography: optionally set a Heading font and a Body font (use available, loaded fonts).
Cards/boxes: control background color + opacity, corner radius, blur (glass effect), and shadow.
Hero text: dedicated controls to force hero heading/text colors and add optional text shadow.

savePublish.title: 5) Save, Preview, Publish
bullets: Save Draft frequently - your changes are stored but not visible to the public.
Preview shows the page as visitors would see it (without publishing).
Publish pushes the current draft live to your website.

navigation.title: 6) Navigation menu
bullets: Open Navigation to add, remove, or reorder menu items.
Link items to a page (slug) or an external URL.

revisions.title: 7) Revisions & undo
bullets: Use the History tab to view or restore previous versions of a page.
If you make a mistake, roll back to an earlier revision.

assets.title: 8) Assets, folders & tags
bullets: All uploaded images are in Assets. Reuse them anywhere - no need to upload twice.
Organize with folders and tags (great for larger libraries).
Click "{{assetsLabel}}" (above) for management.

optimization.title: 9) Image sizing & optimization
bullets: Uploads are automatically resized (server creates multiple width variants).
Large files are rejected based on site policy (size cap) to keep pages fast.
Prefer WEBP/JPG. Add alt text for logos/key images (accessibility + SEO).
Storage is pluggable: today files live on the server; moving to S3/CDN later requires only a backend config change - the editor flow stays the same.

navStyle.title: 10) Website Navigation & Menu
bullets: Open the “Website Navigation & Menu” panel to style the top bar while you work.
Pick a variant (pill, underline, ghost, etc.) and set hover / active / background colors.
Adjust spacing, padding, and the brand/slug font + size — the preview mirrors the nav instantly.
Try Quick Presets for fast inspiration; fine-tune any value and click Save to keep it.
navStyle.footnote: Menu visibility/order still comes from Page Settings (toggle “Show in menu” + sort order).

livePreview.title: 11) Live preview & sticky controls
bullets: While styling nav or page visuals, the floating preview stays pinned near your scroll position.
Use the toolbar to reset, compare, or save without climbing back to the top of the inspector.
Click anywhere on the canvas (e.g., the Hero) to activate Inspector controls for that section.

tipsList: If text is hard to read on a busy background, lower card opacity, add blur, or tweak hero overlay.
Use consistent fonts across the page for a cohesive look.
Service Grid: add images and concise descriptions; keep prices/meta short.
Logo Cloud: use monochrome option for a cleaner, unified look.
troubleshootingList: Image doesn't show: ensure it's uploaded (Assets) or the URL is correct. Prefer your uploaded copy over external links.
Fonts not changing: make sure the font is actually loaded in your app (e.g., via Google Fonts or self-hosted CSS), then set it in Page Style.
Looks different from live: you may be viewing a draft. Click Publish to push changes.
External image blocked: CSP/CORS on the source may block hotlinking. Upload the file to Assets instead.
websiteBuilder.uploadsDescription: Files are stored on the server today and automatically resized into variants. When you move to S3 or another CDN, the upload flow and UI stay the same - only the backend storage target changes.

marketing.title: Marketing Campaigns - Manager Guide
marketing.intro: This page lets you email targeted clients (or everyone) using clean, branded emails with your salon colors and a plain-text fallback.
quickStartSteps: Set your fields (discount, coupon, dates, links).
Click Preview to see eligible clients and the exact email per row.
Select rows or use Send All.
Turn Dry-run OFF to actually send.
Click Send Selected or Send All.
marketing.quickStartTip: Tip: If you change any fields, previews are cleared. Click Preview again before sending.

customize.title: Customize email text
customize.description: Each campaign (except Broadcast, which already collects full copy) includes a "Customize email text (optional)" accordion. You can override the template copy without touching HTML.
customize.note: Leave any field blank to fall back to the professional default.

broadcast.title: 0) Broadcast (Simple Announcement)
broadcast.goal: Send a quick announcement to everyone or a filtered slice (closures, holiday hours, policy updates).
audience: All clients or No future booking (exclude clients with a future appointment).
Only clients seen in the last N days (optional).
highlights: Subject / Heading / Intro / Subtext - your message (Intro/Subtext support multi-line).
Button text / link - optional CTA; relative (e.g., ?page=services-classic) or full URL.
Coupon / Expires on - optional; shown in the email and passed to the link.
Limit - cap total recipients for safety.
broadcast.bestUse: Closures, schedule changes, promos, new policies.

winback.title: 1) Win-Back (Likely to Lapse)
winback.goal: Nudge clients overdue relative to their usual cadence.
highlights: Overdue x gap - threshold (e.g., 1.5 = 50% later than usual).
Discount % - percent shown in email copy.
Valid days - fallback if Expires on is blank.
Expires on (override) - exact date shown and passed to the link.
Limit - cap the audience.
Coupon prefix / override - blank override suggests codes like WINBACK123.
Rebook URL - CTA destination (tracking + coupon added automatically).
winback.bestUse: Monthly pulse to re-activate clients who are slipping.

skipped.title: 2) Skipped Rebook Nudge
skipped.goal: Follow up after a recent visit if the client didn't book again.
highlights: Lookback (days) - window for the previous kept visit.
Discount % - set to 0 for a gentle reminder.
Coupon prefix / override - optional incentive.
Deep link - landing page for a quick rebook.
skipped.bestUse: A friendly reminder a few days after the appointment.

vip.title: 3) VIP Loyalty
vip.goal: Reward top spenders or frequent visitors with early access or a perk.
highlights: Top % (by LTV) - pick the slice of high-value clients.
Limit - cap recipients if you want scarcity.
Discount % - the perk shown in the copy.
Coupon prefix / override - generate personal VIP codes.
VIP link - landing page for the exclusive offer.
vip.bestUse: Early access promos, special events, or loyalty perks.

anniversary.title: 4) Anniversary (Client-versary)
anniversary.goal: Celebrate the month of the client's first visit.
highlights: Month - which month to celebrate (defaults to current).
Limit - cap recipients.
Coupon prefix / override - gift code.
Anniversary link - CTA (tracking + coupon/expiry appended).
Expires on - when the perk ends.
Require email - set to No to preview even if some clients lack email.
anniversary.bestUse: Friendly monthly thank-you with a small perk.

newService.title: New Service Launch
newService.goal: Announce a new service to recent visitors who haven't tried it.
highlights: Service (search by name), Lookback (months), Discount %.
Coupon prefix / override, Launch link, Expires on, Limit.
newService.note: Use the service picker to search by name; the ID fills automatically.

noShow.title: No-Show Recovery
noShow.goal: Make-good follow-up to rebook clients who were charged a no-show fee or marked no-show.
highlights: Lookback (days), Require no future booking to exclude those already rebooked.
Discount %, Coupon prefix / override, Landing link, Expires on, Limit.

addon.title: Add-on Upsell
addon.goal: Offer a popular add-on to recent base-service clients (simple & fast).
highlights: Base service (search by name), Add-on name, Lookback (days).
Discount %, Coupon prefix / override, Deep link, Expires on, Limit.
addon.note: Use the service picker to search by name; the ID fills automatically.

discountPercent.label: Discount %
discountPercent.description: Shown in the email copy. Set to 0 for a non-discount nudge. If Coupon override is blank, the email hides the coupon block.

coupon.label: Coupon prefix / override
coupon.description: If Override is filled, the exact code is shown and passed along. If blank, a smart code is generated from the prefix.

expires.label: Expires on
expires.description: Exact date printed in the email and passed as expires=YYYY-MM-DD.

links.label: Links
links.description: Links automatically append ?coupon=CODE&expires=YYYY-MM-DD&utm_source=<campaign> so landing pages can display the code and analytics can attribute traffic.

preview.label: Preview
preview.description: Fetches eligible clients and renders the final email per row. Change any setting? Preview again.

dryRun.label: Dry-run
dryRun.description: When ON, nothing is sent; we log a "would send" count. Turn OFF to send.

send.label: Send Selected / Send All
send.description: Uses the rows from your most recent preview. "Selected" sends only the checked rows; "All" sends every previewed row.

export.title: Export clients (company-scoped)
export.description: Use Export clients to download a CSV/XLSX of clients who have appointments with your company. Filters include "Seen in last N days", "Min visits", and "Require email". Data is tenant-isolated.

noRows.label: Preview shows no rows
noRows.description: Adjust filters or widen the window, depending on the campaign.
list: Broadcast: reduce filters (e.g., clear "Seen in last N days").
Win-Back: lower Overdue x gap or increase Limit.
Anniversary: choose the correct month and ensure first-visit dates exist.
No-Show: widen Lookback or temporarily allow clients without email to inspect counts.

sentZero.label: "Sent: 0 - dry_run=on/off"
sentZero.description: Interpret the dry-run indicator and selection state.
list: on - Dry-run is ON; no emails sent by design.
off - Likely no rows selected (re-preview and select rows) or the server suppressed exact duplicates within that send.

duplicates.label: Client says they received multiple copies
duplicates.description: We suppress duplicates within a single send (same recipient + subject + body). If you rerun the same content later, clients may get it again.

coupon.label: Coupon doesn't apply at checkout
coupon.description: Emails do not create coupons. Create/enable the matching code in Coupon Management, or keep coupons informational only.

button.label: Where does the button go?
button.description: Your chosen link. We append coupon, expires, and utm_source so landing pages can prefill/show the code and analytics can attribute traffic.

copyTips.title: Copy tips (salon-friendly)

items.vip: VIP: "Early access just for you. Prime slots go fast-reserve your favorite time now."
items.winback: Win-Back: "It's been a while-we'd love to see you again. Book by {date}."
items.skipped: Skipped Rebook: "Rebook the same pro in 3 clicks-keep your routine effortless."
items.anniversary: Anniversary: "Happy client-versary! Enjoy a little thank-you from our team."
items.broadcast: Broadcast: Keep it warm and clear-what's changing, and what clients should do next.

copyTips.subject: Subject lines: keep them short (<= 45 chars). Examples: "VIP Early Access: save {X}%", "We miss you - book by {date}", "Closed Monday - back Tuesday", "A little gift for your month {emoji}".

items.emailsOnly: Only clients with a valid email can receive emails (some campaigns let you preview without email).
items.consent: Include any required consent/unsubscribe text for your region in your base template.
items.tenant: Exports are tenant-isolated: only clients who booked with your company are included.

marketing.editorTip: Editor tip: Long message fields support multi-line editing. Press Enter for new lines.

winback.title: Win-Back (Likely to Lapse)

skippedRebook.title: Skipped Rebook Nudge

help.title: Need a checklist?
help.subtitle: Quick reminders for Stripe setup:
items: Complete Stripe Connect onboarding so charges and payouts stay enabled.
Set checkout mode, publishable key, and logo under Checkout Pro & Payments.
Update tax country, region, and display currency in Company Profile.
Use Advanced Management → Payments to charge cards on file or issue refunds.
Detailed checkout & tax controls live under Settings → Checkout Pro & Payments (link below).

taxGuide.title: Tax setup guide (for managers)
taxGuide.intro: Follow this once and tax will be calculated automatically on every payment.

pricesIncludeTax.on: Prices include tax: (currently ON — prices shown include tax)
pricesIncludeTax.off: Prices include tax: (currently OFF — tax will be added on top)

connect.heading: 2) Connect Stripe (one-time)
connect.useButton: Use the Connect with Stripe button above and finish onboarding.
connect.ready: When it says Ready to accept payments, you're all set.

stripe.heading: 3) In Stripe — turn on Automatic tax
stripe.navigate: Go to Tax → Overview and switch Automatic tax to ON.
stripe.origin: In Business information: set your Origin address (where your business is based).
stripe.products: In Products & prices: pick a default tax category (start with “General — Services”; you can refine per product later).
stripe.includeQuestion: Include tax in prices? Choose No to add tax on top (most US/CA teams), or Yes if your prices already include tax.

registrations.heading: 4) Registrations (where you collect tax)
registrations.homeRegion: Add your home region (e.g., Ontario or Texas).
registrations.additionalRegions: Add other provinces/states only where you are registered or when Stripe notifies you that a threshold is met.
registrations.thresholds: Enable Thresholds monitoring so Stripe alerts you as you grow.

taxGuide.tip: Tip: If your price is $40 and Prices include tax is OFF, customers will see $40 + tax at checkout. If it’s ON, the $40 already contains tax and Stripe will back the tax out automatically.

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.usRegistration: Do I need US registration to sell to US customers? Only if you meet a state's threshold or choose to register there. Start with your home region; add others as needed.
faqs.receipts: Does Stripe handle receipts? Yes. Receipts are issued in your business name.
faqs.crossBorder: What about cross-border orders? Tax depends on the buyer's location and where you're registered. If you aren't registered in a region, Stripe won't collect there.

domainHelp.title: Custom Domain Guide
domainHelp.subtitle: Follow these steps to connect your marketing site or booking experience to your own domain.

labels.registrarPlaybooksSubtitle: Use these guides for the registrars our customers rely on the most.

quickSummary.title: Quick summary
items: Prefer .com when available—customers trust it the most.
Start with the www version (www.yoursite.com). You can add the apex later if needed.
Avoid trademarks or other brands in your domain to prevent DNS issues.
Generate the TXT + CNAME records from Schedulaa.
Add those records at your DNS provider (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, etc.).
DNS can take up to 30 minutes to propagate—verify a little later if it is still pending.

dnsInstructions.title: What "DNS instructions generated" means
items: When you see this message, Schedulaa has already produced the DNS records you need to finish setup.
You will also see the DNS Instructions box appear below the button with both records ready to copy.
TXT record: proves you own the domain so only your team can connect it.
CNAME record: routes www to Schedulaa so visitors reach your booking site.
Log into your registrar (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, etc.), open DNS Records or Manage Zones, and add both records exactly as shown.
TXT record - Name/Host: _schedulaa (or _schedulaa.www if required) | Value: the random token displayed in Schedulaa.
CNAME record - Name/Host: www | Points to: schedulaa.com.
Save your changes and wait 5-30 minutes for DNS to update, then return to Schedulaa and click Verify DNS.
Once verified, https://www.yourdomain.com is live, SSL auto-issues, and all booking links, Stripe checkouts, and emails use your brand domain.
The TXT value you see in Schedulaa is your verification token; copy it exactly.

timing.title: How long does DNS take?
items: Most changes appear within 5-15 minutes.
Some registrars can take up to 1 hour.
Schedulaa automatically checks every few minutes; you can also click Refresh Status.

security.title: Security and SSL
items: Every verified domain automatically gets a TLS (SSL) certificate so visitor data stays encrypted end-to-end.
Certificates renew automatically. There is no manual work required.
Schedulaa only issues certificates after ownership is verified, so nobody else can claim your domain.
You will see SSL Pending and then SSL Active in Schedulaa after verification; no manual certificate install is needed.

baseSections.title: Before you start
bullets: Confirm you have manager permissions for this company.
Decide which hostname you want customers to use (we recommend www.yoursite.com for launch).
Have your DNS credentials ready so you can add TXT and CNAME records without delay.

baseSections.title: Purchase or choose a domain
bullets: If you need a new domain, buy it now (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, or your preferred registrar).
Use a clear brand name, avoid trademarks, and prefer .com when available.
Keep both www and bare versions handy in case you want apex forwarding later.

baseSections.title: Generate DNS instructions
bullets: Enter the domain inside Schedulaa and click Generate DNS Instructions.
Schedulaa issues a TXT record for ownership and a CNAME to route traffic.
Leave the instructions open so you can copy the exact host/value pairs into your DNS portal.

baseSections.title: Add DNS records at your registrar
bullets: Create the TXT record named _schedulaa with the token we provide.
Add the CNAME record for www (or your chosen host) pointing to schedulaa.com.
Save changes and give DNS a few minutes to propagate before you verify.
baseSections.tip: Tip: DNS instructions generated means Schedulaa already created your verification records. Add them to your registrar, save, and click Verify DNS to finish.

baseSections.title: Verify and go live
bullets: Back in Schedulaa, click Verify DNS.
When verification succeeds, SSL provisioning starts automatically (Caddy or Cloudflare depending on your plan).
Once SSL is active, flip any marketing links and emails to the new domain.

baseSections.title: Post-launch checklist
bullets: Visit the new domain in an incognito window to ensure redirects and branding look right.
Update Stripe, email templates, and QR codes?they already use tenantBaseUrl but double-check your saved copy.
Enable the email notification toggle in Schedulaa so managers know when SSL or DNS changes occur.

connectSteps.title: GoDaddy Domain Connect
bullets: Start from Schedulaa using the Connect automatically button when we detect GoDaddy.
Approve the GoDaddy prompt - this authorizes us to add the TXT and CNAME on your behalf.
Return to Schedulaa; we will poll GoDaddy, verify DNS, and start SSL automatically.

connectSteps.title: GoDaddy manual fallback
bullets: If Domain Connect fails, open GoDaddy > My Products > DNS > Manage Zones.
Add TXT _schedulaa with the token from Schedulaa. Add CNAME www pointing to schedulaa.com.
Save and retry verification after a few minutes. Disable proxy or CDN if records still do not resolve.

connectSteps.title: Namecheap manual steps
bullets: Go to Domain List > Manage > Advanced DNS.
Add a TXT record with host _schedulaa and the verification token, TTL 1 minute or Automatic.
Add a CNAME record for www pointing to schedulaa.com, save, then verify inside Schedulaa.

connectSteps.title: Cloudflare registrar or proxy
bullets: In Cloudflare, add the TXT and CNAME records under DNS > Records.
If proxy (orange cloud) is enabled for the CNAME, temporarily switch it to DNS only until verification finishes.
After SSL is active in Schedulaa, you can re-enable the proxy to leverage Cloudflare caching.

rows.fix: Use the exact record shown in Schedulaa.
Delete the A record for www before adding the CNAME.
Wait 30 minutes, then click Verify DNS again.

rows.cause: Another account connected the same domain
rows.fix: Contact Schedulaa Support so we can transfer ownership.

advanced.title: Advanced options (later)
items: Automatic setup (GoDaddy Domain Connect): When available, click Connect Automatically and skip manual DNS entries.
Cloudflare proxy: Turn the orange cloud off during verification, then back on once SSL is active.
Apex forwarding: After www is live, add a forward from yourdomain.com to www.yourdomain.com inside your registrar dashboard.

ownership.title: Ownership and safety
items: You always keep full control of your domain at your registrar.
Schedulaa cannot transfer, bill, or renew domains on your behalf.
We simply verify ownership so the booking site can run securely on your hostname.

supportSections.title: Need more help?
bullets: Schedulaa support can walk you through DNS changes or complete Domain Connect on your behalf.
Share screenshots of your DNS zone or the exact error message to speed up troubleshooting.

commands.title: Check with a command line (optional)
items: nslookup -type=txt _schedulaa.www.yourdomain.com
nslookup -type=cname www.yourdomain.com
commands.footer: If both commands return the correct values, return to Schedulaa and click Verify DNS.

summary.title: In summary
items: Serve securely over HTTPS.
Show your company name and branding everywhere.
Keep SSL renewals automatic without extra tools.
Stay safe - Schedulaa only connects, never owns your domain.

accountingGuides.title: Accounting guides
accountingGuides.subtitle: Deep-dive QuickBooks and Xero onboarding playbooks with mapping, defaults, and export guardrails.

quickbooks.title: Schedulaa + QuickBooks setup guide
quickbooks.summary: Map once, validate the chips, and sync payroll or revenue exports with a single click.
quickbooks.quickLinkDescription: Mapping, defaults, cost centers, and export guardrails.

sections.heading: Prerequisites
items: Use QuickBooks Essentials, Plus, or Advanced to expose customer lists (Simple Start sandboxes do not).
Enable Classes and Locations if you plan to tag Schedulaa departments as cost centers.
Create or reuse the wage, liability, and revenue accounts you plan to map (income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, net pay, service/product revenue, and sales tax).

sections.heading: 1. Why mapping is required
items: QuickBooks accepts journals only when every category—wages, deductions, FICA/Medicare, net pay, revenue, tax, tips—points to a real account.
Schedulaa uses those mappings to build balanced debit/credit lines; when the chips turn green, Sync to QuickBooks is ready.

sections.heading: 2. How mapping works
items: Under Payroll and Revenue mapping, choose the exact account codes from your QuickBooks chart.
Need a new account? Create it in QuickBooks and click Refresh (or reconnect) so it appears in the dropdown.
Mappings can be edited at any time—future exports automatically use the new accounts.

sections.heading: 3. Recommended accounts
items: Expenses: Wages & Salaries, Holiday/Vacation Pay, Tips Paid, Sales Commissions.
Liabilities: Income tax payable, CPP/QPP payable, EI payable, FICA payable (U.S.), Medicare payable (U.S.), Tips payable.
Net pay: Payroll Checking or a dedicated payroll clearing account so the journal balances.
Revenue: Service Income, Product Sales, Sales Tax Payable, Tips Payable.

sections.heading: 4. Exporting payroll
items: Finalize the pay run in Schedulaa, load it in Payroll Preview, and click Sync to QuickBooks.
Schedulaa posts a balanced Journal Entry (wages/vacation/tips/commissions debited; income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, and net pay credited).
Class/Location tags are attached automatically when departments are mapped.
No manual edits are required inside QuickBooks.

sections.heading: 5. Exporting revenue, invoices, and sales receipts
items: Summarized revenue journal: export service revenue, product revenue, sales tax collected, and tips payable for any date range.
Invoices or Sales Receipts: set default Item/Customer, pick the document type and date range, and Schedulaa creates QuickBooks documents per transaction.
Every export stores the resulting QuickBooks ID on the transaction for audit trails.

sections.heading: 6. Locking periods and backdated exports
items: Use “Lock exports before” to prevent journals from posting into closed months.
Disable backdated exports if you want strict accounting controls; re-enable when finance approves a historical post.

sections.heading: 7. Integration Activity
items: Every export is logged with date, provider, type, status, external ID, and the manager who triggered it.
Check Workspace Settings → Integration Activity to confirm QuickBooks sync history or troubleshoot failures.

sections.heading: 8. Common questions
items: Do I need every account pre-created? No—map to existing accounts or create new ones in QuickBooks first, then refresh.
Can I change mappings later? Yes—future exports immediately use the new mapping.
Why is the Customer dropdown empty? Essentials/Plus/Advanced expose the list; Simple Start sandboxes do not.
Do payroll exports require customers? No—only invoice/sales receipt exports use CustomerRef.

sections.heading: 9. Quick setup checklist
items: Map payroll expenses and liabilities (including FICA/Medicare if U.S.).
Map net pay → bank, plus service/product revenue, tax, and tips payable.
Configure default Class/Location/Item/Customer (optional) and Departments ↔ Class/Location mappings.
Finalize payroll → Sync to QuickBooks → confirm success in Integration Activity.

sections.heading: 10. Success flow
items: Green status chips + lock-date guardrails enabled.
Integration Activity shows a success entry with ManualJournalID or Invoice ID.
Accounting can reconcile journals without editing them manually.

xero.title: Schedulaa + Xero setup guide
xero.summary: Map accounts, configure tracking defaults, and lock accounting periods before syncing Schedulaa payroll or revenue journals to Xero.
xero.quickLinkDescription: Manual journal mapping, tracking, and lock-date controls.

sections.heading: Prerequisites
items: Create or reuse the Xero expense/liability accounts you plan to map (wages, vacation, tips, commissions, income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, net pay, service/product revenue, tax collected).
Add Tracking Categories (e.g., Departments or Locations) with options for each branch if you plan to map Schedulaa departments.

sections.heading: 1. Why mapping is required
items: Xero accepts a manual journal only when every line—wages, deductions, FICA/Medicare, net pay, revenue, tax, tips—points to a real account.
Schedulaa builds those debit/credit lines automatically; green status chips indicate all required kinds are mapped.

sections.heading: 2. How mapping works
items: Under Payroll and Revenue mapping, choose the account code straight from your Xero chart.
Need a new account? Create it in Xero, reconnect or refresh, then map it here.
Mappings can be changed at any time—future exports reuse the most recent selections.

sections.heading: 3. Recommended accounts
items: Expenses: Wages & Salaries, Holiday/Vacation Pay, Tips Paid, Sales Commissions.
Liabilities: Income tax payable, CPP/QPP payable, EI payable, FICA payable (U.S.), Medicare payable (U.S.), Tips payable.
Net pay: Payroll clearing or your payroll bank account.
Revenue: Service Income, Product Sales, Sales Tax Payable, Tips Payable.

sections.heading: 4. Exporting payroll
items: Finalize payroll in Schedulaa, load the run, and click Sync to Xero.
Schedulaa sends a balanced journal (wages + employer portions + deductions + net pay + tips payable).
Tracking categories are attached per department or fall back to your default tracking selection.

sections.heading: 5. Exporting revenue / sales
items: Use the revenue export card to push summarized service/product revenue, sales tax collected, and tips payable for a date range.
Each export stores the returned ManualJournalID so finance can audit the sync.

sections.heading: 6. Default tracking & lock date
items: Set a default tracking category + option so unmapped transactions still land in the correct cost center.
Use “Lock exports before” + “Allow backdated exports” to block journals from posting into closed periods.

sections.heading: 7. Departments ↔ Tracking
items: Map each Schedulaa department to a Xero tracking category option (e.g., Downtown Studio, York Mills).
During export, Schedulaa attaches the department’s tracking option; if none exist, it uses your default tracking.

sections.heading: 8. Common questions
items: Do I need every account pre-created? No—map to existing accounts or add new ones in Xero first, then refresh.
Can I change mappings later? Yes—future exports immediately use the updated mapping.
Not seeing tracking categories? Add them in Xero (Accounting → Accounting settings → Tracking categories) and click Refresh.

sections.heading: 9. Quick setup checklist
items: Map payroll expenses and liabilities (including FICA/Medicare for U.S. entities).
Map net pay, service/product revenue, tax collected, and tips payable.
Configure default tracking + lock date, then map departments ↔ tracking options.
Finalize payroll → Sync to Xero → confirm success in Integration Activity.

vagaro.metaTitle: Schedulaa vs Vagaro | Booking, Payroll, and Operations Comparison
vagaro.metaDescription: See how Schedulaa compares to Vagaro for booking, payroll, and analytics. Learn which platform fits growing service businesses best.
vagaro.heroTitle: Schedulaa vs Vagaro — Which Platform Is Right for Your Business?
vagaro.heroSubtitle: Vagaro focuses on salons and spas. Schedulaa unifies booking, staff scheduling, payroll, e-commerce, and analytics for service brands of any size.
intro: Both Schedulaa and Vagaro help service-based businesses manage clients and appointments, but their focus is different.

Vagaro is built primarily for salons and spas, while Schedulaa is designed as an all-in-one operations platform that unifies booking, staff scheduling, payroll, e-commerce, and analytics — from beauty studios to creative agencies.

rows.label: Core Purpose
rows.schedulaa: All-in-one operations platform: booking, scheduling, payroll, analytics, and commerce.
rows.competitor: Appointment software for salons, spas, and fitness studios.

rows.label: Target Industry
rows.schedulaa: Service businesses across beauty, creative, and professional sectors.

rows.label: Platform Model
rows.schedulaa: Business-branded platform (custom domain + logo).

rows.label: Client Booking
rows.schedulaa: Built-in booking pages, customizable intake forms, automated confirmations.
rows.competitor: Booking via Vagaro marketplace and app.

rows.label: Staff Scheduling
rows.schedulaa: Integrated team scheduling, shifts, notifications, and swaps.

rows.label: Payroll & Compliance
rows.schedulaa: Built-in Canadian (T4, ROE) and U.S. (W-2) payroll tools.
rows.competitor: Limited payroll functionality; requires third-party integrations.

rows.label: E-Commerce & Sales
rows.schedulaa: Direct product and service sales through company domain.
rows.competitor: Available through Vagaro platform with fees.

rows.label: Automation
rows.schedulaa: Automatic confirmations, cancellations, reschedules, and 10-minute reminders.
rows.competitor: Reminders and confirmations through SMS and app.

rows.label: Video Meetings
rows.schedulaa: Integrated Jitsi link generation for virtual services.

rows.label: Analytics Dashboard
rows.schedulaa: End-to-end reporting across bookings, sales, payroll, and staff.
rows.competitor: Insights focused on bookings and client metrics.

rows.label: Brand Customization
rows.schedulaa: Full brand control and white-label experience.
rows.competitor: Vagaro branding across most client interfaces.

rows.label: Pricing Structure
rows.schedulaa: Flat monthly tiers starting at $19.99.

differentiators.title: Platform identity and brand ownership
differentiators.body: Schedulaa lets you operate under your own domain, logo, and booking experience — ideal for premium or multi-brand businesses. Vagaro’s shared marketplace keeps the Vagaro brand front-and-center for every client interaction.

differentiators.title: Integrated payroll and compliance
differentiators.body: Schedulaa includes payroll and compliance tooling for Canada and the United States, reducing add-ons and manual reconciliation. Vagaro relies on external services when businesses scale beyond a few employees.

differentiators.title: Custom domains and automation
differentiators.body: Schedulaa pages live on your domain with branded forms, emails, and automated confirmations. Vagaro offers hosted pages with limited customization options.

differentiators.title: Broader industry fit
differentiators.body: Schedulaa is industry-agnostic: salons, photographers, tutors, clinics, and agencies can run booking, payroll, and analytics in one ecosystem. Vagaro stays focused on beauty and wellness.

differentiators.title: Simplicity and cost control
differentiators.body: Flat-rate pricing keeps Schedulaa predictable as teams grow. Vagaro’s per-user and add-on fees can increase quickly for multi-location businesses.

rows.label: Booking Workflow
rows.schedulaa: Integrated and fully automated.

rows.label: Payroll Support
rows.schedulaa: Built-in, cross-border (CA + US).

rows.label: Brand Control
rows.schedulaa: Full white-label customization.

rows.label: Reminders & Notifications
rows.schedulaa: Automated emails/SMS plus post-visit review and tip nudges.
rows.competitor: SMS reminders via the Vagaro app; limited follow-up tooling.

rows.label: Analytics & Insights
rows.schedulaa: Unified dashboard for bookings, shifts, payroll.
rows.competitor: Focused on client visits and sales.

rows.label: Scalability
rows.schedulaa: Built for multi-brand, multi-region expansion.

fitMatrix.scenario: A salon, spa, or fitness studio that values marketplace visibility.
A growing brand or multi-service business that needs automation, payroll, and full control.
Professional studios, clinics, or agencies needing branded client portals.

testimonial.quote: Schedulaa replaced multiple tools for our salon. Bookings, shift tracking, and payroll now happen in one dashboard — clients never leave our domain.

vagaro.conclusion: Vagaro centralizes the beauty marketplace experience. Schedulaa centralizes your operations under your own brand. If your goal is growth, automation, and independence, Schedulaa provides the structure to scale across teams, services, and countries.

square-appointments.metaTitle: Schedulaa vs Square Appointments | Booking System Comparison
square-appointments.metaDescription: Compare Schedulaa with Square Appointments. Learn when to use a full operations platform instead of a booking-only tool.
square-appointments.heroTitle: Schedulaa vs Square Appointments — Complete Operations Platform vs Booking System
square-appointments.heroSubtitle: Square Appointments focuses on appointment booking and POS. Schedulaa adds scheduling, payroll, HR, and analytics under your own brand.
intro: Both Schedulaa and Square Appointments make it easier to schedule clients and accept payments.
Square excels at point-of-sale workflows; Schedulaa delivers the entire operational ecosystem for multi-staff service teams.

rows.label: Core Purpose
rows.schedulaa: All-in-one platform for booking, scheduling, payroll, HR, and analytics.

rows.label: Target Audience
rows.schedulaa: Service businesses, salons, clinics, studios, agencies.

rows.label: Client Booking
rows.schedulaa: Custom-branded pages with intake forms and domain mapping.
rows.competitor: Square-hosted booking page or ecosystem widget.

rows.label: Staff Scheduling
rows.schedulaa: Shift management, availability, swap requests.

rows.label: Payroll & Compliance
rows.schedulaa: Integrated for Canada (T4, ROE) and U.S. (W-2).

rows.label: Leave Management
rows.schedulaa: Built-in requests, approvals, tracking.

rows.label: Video Meetings

rows.label: Brand Customization

rows.label: Analytics & Reports

rows.label: E-Commerce & Payments
rows.schedulaa: Built-in commerce for services and products.

rows.label: Pricing Structure
rows.schedulaa: Flat tiers starting at $19.99.

differentiators.title: End-to-end operations
differentiators.body: Square Appointments handles booking and POS. Schedulaa continues through staffing, payroll, HR, and analytics.

differentiators.title: Branded experience
differentiators.body: Schedulaa keeps clients on your domain with custom forms and emails. Square maintains a shared ecosystem with Square branding.

differentiators.title: Payroll, HR, and compliance

differentiators.title: Automation beyond reminders

xero.metaTitle: Schedulaa vs Xero | Operations OS vs Cloud Accounting
xero.metaDescription: Compare Schedulaa’s booking, scheduling, payroll, and website tools with Xero’s cloud accounting platform. See why service teams run operations in Schedulaa and sync the numbers to Xero.
xero.heroTitle: Schedulaa vs Xero — Run Operations + Keep the Books
xero.heroSubtitle: Xero is a world-class accounting ledger. Schedulaa is the operations OS that generates the hours, bookings, and payroll data Xero needs. They complement each other, not replace each other.
intro: Schedulaa and Xero both serve modern service businesses but at different layers of the stack.
Schedulaa runs day-to-day operations — client booking, shift scheduling, payroll prep, and branded websites. Xero records those results in the general ledger, runs direct deposit, and files taxes.

rows.label: Core Purpose
rows.schedulaa: Operations OS: booking, scheduling, shift-aware payroll, websites, analytics.
rows.competitor: Cloud accounting & bookkeeping: general ledger, invoices, bank feeds, tax filings.

rows.label: Primary Audience
rows.schedulaa: Service businesses managing clients, teams, and multi-location workflows.
rows.competitor: Accountants, bookkeepers, and finance-first business owners.

rows.label: Client Booking
rows.schedulaa: Built-in booking website, intake forms, deposits, and reminders on your domain.
rows.competitor: Not included; requires external booking or scheduling tools.

rows.label: Payroll & Compliance
rows.schedulaa: Integrated CA + US workflows with W-2, T4, ROE exports tied to real shifts.
rows.competitor: Payroll modules in select regions; handles remittance and direct deposit but depends on external hour tracking.

rows.label: Shift Scheduling & Leave
rows.schedulaa: Native staff scheduling, leave approvals, swap workflows, overtime detection.
rows.competitor: Not available; relies on third-party time-tracking/HR apps.

rows.label: Websites & Domains
rows.schedulaa: Website builder, custom domains, client/staff portals, Stripe checkout.
rows.competitor: No website tools; focuses purely on accounting.

rows.label: Automation Scope
rows.schedulaa: Client + staff workflows: confirmations, reminders, leave approvals, payroll exports.
rows.competitor: Accounting automation: bank feeds, invoicing rules, recurring bills, tax filings.

rows.label: Analytics
rows.schedulaa: Operational analytics across bookings, shifts, payroll, revenue, and departments.
rows.competitor: Financial statements: P&L, balance sheet, cash flow, tax summaries.

rows.label: Role in the Stack
rows.schedulaa: Runs the business — where hours, bookings, and payroll data are created.
rows.competitor: Keeps the books — where revenue, expenses, and payroll payments are reconciled.

rows.label: Integrations
rows.schedulaa: Exports clean payroll and revenue data to accounting systems like Xero/QuickBooks.
rows.competitor: Connects to POS, expense, and payroll apps; still requires an operations system for service teams.

rows.label: Pricing Structure
rows.schedulaa: Flat monthly tiers starting at $19.99 with staff/location bundles.
rows.competitor: Per-organization plans plus payroll add-ons by region.

differentiators.title: Front-of-house vs. back-office
differentiators.body: Schedulaa orchestrates bookings, shifts, payroll prep, and branded experiences. Xero records the money movement and files taxes. Together they cover the full lifecycle.

differentiators.title: Shift-aware payroll vs. ledger payroll
differentiators.body: Schedulaa knows who worked, tips, overtime, and leave policies. Xero’s payroll module focuses on direct deposit and remittance after an external system supplies the hours.

differentiators.title: Website + booking vs. accounting UI
differentiators.body: Schedulaa ships a site builder, booking portals, and Stripe checkout under your domain. Xero assumes you already have client-facing tools and concentrates on finance.

differentiators.title: Service-business focus
differentiators.body: Schedulaa was designed for salons, studios, clinics, agencies, tutors, and recruiters. Xero is industry-agnostic accounting; it doesn’t replace an operations platform.

differentiators.title: Designed to work together
differentiators.body: Schedulaa can export payroll and revenue data to Xero so accountants reconcile and run direct deposit. You run the business in Schedulaa and close the books in Xero.

rows.label: Booking & Scheduling
rows.schedulaa: Included: client booking pages, staff availability, shift management, leave, and reminders.
rows.competitor: Not included; requires external booking/scheduling tools.

rows.label: Payroll & Compliance
rows.schedulaa: Shift-aware payroll with W-2, T4, ROE exports tied to schedules, tips, commissions.
rows.competitor: Payroll add-on handles direct deposit/remittance once hours are provided.

rows.label: HR & Leave Management
rows.schedulaa: Integrated leave approvals, overtime rules, swap workflows, branch policies.

rows.label: Websites & Domains
rows.schedulaa: Website builder, custom domain, booking & Stripe Checkout on your brand.

rows.label: Automation Scope
rows.schedulaa: Client/staff workflows: confirmations, reminders, swaps, leave, payroll exports.
rows.competitor: Accounting workflows: bank feeds, invoicing rules, recurring bills, tax filings.

rows.label: Analytics
rows.schedulaa: Operational dashboards across bookings, shifts, payroll, revenue, departments.
rows.competitor: Financial statements: P&L, balance sheet, cash flow, GST/VAT returns.

rows.label: Branding & Domain
rows.schedulaa: White-label portals on your own domain for clients and staff.

rows.label: Role in the Stack
rows.schedulaa: Runs daily operations — generates the data accountants need.
rows.competitor: Keeps the books — reconciles, files, and moves money.

fitMatrix.scenario: You need client booking, shift scheduling, payroll prep, and branded portals.
You only need a general ledger, invoicing, and tax filings.
You want operations + clean books without double entry.

testimonial.quote: Schedulaa tells us what happened — who worked, which services ran, and what was earned. Xero tells our accountant how it rolls up into the books. Together they finally match.

xero.conclusion: Xero remains a leading choice for cloud accounting and payroll remittance. Schedulaa focuses on the operational reality of service businesses — from booking and staffing to payroll-ready data and branded portals. Most service brands run daily operations in Schedulaa and sync the results to Xero (or QuickBooks) to keep the books clean.

deputy.metaTitle: Schedulaa vs Deputy | Operations OS vs Workforce Scheduling
deputy.metaDescription: See how Schedulaa stacks up against Deputy. Schedulaa unifies booking, website, payroll, commerce, and analytics, while Deputy focuses on scheduling/time‑clock alone.
deputy.heroTitle: Schedulaa vs Deputy — Run Your Entire Business, Not Just Shifts
deputy.heroSubtitle: Deputy is a strong workforce scheduling app. Schedulaa is the operating system that connects booking, websites, payroll, and analytics to scheduling.
intro: Deputy shines at employee scheduling, time clocks, and labor compliance. Schedulaa includes all of that plus client booking, websites, payroll, eCommerce, analytics, and marketing automation.
If you outgrow a pure timeclock tool, Schedulaa becomes the single platform to run every customer and staff workflow end to end.

rows.label: Core Purpose
rows.schedulaa: Operations OS for booking, scheduling, payroll, websites, and analytics.
rows.competitor: Workforce management: scheduling, time & attendance, labor forecasting.

rows.label: Client Booking
rows.schedulaa: Built-in booking flows, deposits, reschedules, add-ons.

rows.label: Payroll
rows.schedulaa: Integrated CA + US payroll engine (W-2, T4, ROE).
rows.competitor: Exports timesheets to third-party payroll—no built-in payroll.

rows.label: Website & Ecommerce
rows.schedulaa: Website builder, custom domain, Stripe checkout, product catalogs.

rows.label: Marketing & CRM
rows.schedulaa: Email/SMS automation, win-back sequences, client CRM.

rows.label: Analytics
rows.schedulaa: Revenue, payroll, staff performance, cancellations, multi-branch.

rows.label: Shift Management
rows.schedulaa: Scheduling, swaps, leave approvals, department views.

rows.label: Time Clock
rows.schedulaa: Planned (schedule-driven).

rows.label: Branding & Multi-site
rows.schedulaa: Multi-tenant, white-label, branch landing pages, legal pages.
rows.competitor: Single account per brand; no public website layer.

rows.label: Time Clock / Attendance
rows.schedulaa: Planned

differentiators.title: All-in-one vs timeclock
differentiators.body: Schedulaa replaces booking, payroll, website builder, eCommerce, analytics, and scheduling. Deputy delivers scheduling/time & attendance only.

differentiators.title: Payroll + Booking loop
differentiators.body: Schedulaa connects bookings → scheduling → payroll → Xero. Deputy requires separate booking systems and payroll processors.

differentiators.title: Website & client experience
differentiators.body: Schedulaa ships white-label websites, booking widgets, and custom domains. Deputy has no client-facing layer.

differentiators.title: Revenue + marketing insight
differentiators.body: Schedulaa tracks revenue, tips, products, cancellations, and rebook triggers with automation. Deputy tracks labor metrics only.

differentiators.title: Xero-ready exports
differentiators.body: Schedulaa syncs revenue and payroll journals directly to Xero. Deputy exports timesheets that still require another system to process.

fitMatrix.scenario: You only need staff scheduling and time-clocking.
You need booking, payroll, website, and scheduling in one place.
You want to feed both revenue and payroll to Xero automatically.

testimonial.quote: Deputy helped us schedule shifts, but Schedulaa became the full command center: bookings, websites, payroll, and analytics all tie together.

deputy.conclusion: Deputy is a great choice when shift scheduling and time clocks are the only requirements. Schedulaa is the better fit when service businesses want to run bookings, websites, scheduling, payroll, commerce, and analytics in one platform and sync it all back to Xero.
